snippet: In the latest episode, a man who was recently in West Africa is being tested after visiting an emergency room with signs of the disease.
abstract: Ebola cases have not yet turned up in New York City, despite several patients who have , exhibited symptoms of the virus being evaluated at local hospitals; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded it is unlikely patients have Ebola and are testing for common causes of illness and to definitely exclude Ebola.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY and MARC SANTORA

lead_paragraph: In the latest episode, a man who was recently in West Africa is being tested after visiting an emergency room with signs of the disease.

headline.main: Patients’ Symptoms Raise Concern About Ebola in New York
headline.print_headline: Ebola Symptoms a Concern in City Hospitals
